elements.title: Therese Forster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Therese Forster (pictured) edited the works of her father Georg Forster, who died when she was seven years old?

elements.title: astronomical clock at Norwich Cathedral (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the costs of the great astronomical clock at Norwich Cathedral that were recorded in its Sacrist's Rolls from 1322 to 1325 provide the earliest known detailed account of clockmaking in England?

elements.title: Arthur J. Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Arthur J. Hill, United States Assistant Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for Housing, was one of four children of a single parent?

elements.title: UEFA Euro 1984 Final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michel Platini scored his ninth goal of the tournament when France won the UEFA Euro 1984 Final?

elements.title: Stoned at the Nail Salon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Stoned at the Nail Salon" was written by Lorde and Jack Antonoff, and features backing vocals from four other artists?

elements.title: Washington Heights, Manhattan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Morris–Jumel Mansion in Washington Heights, Manhattan, where the musical Hamilton was written, has been described as a haunted house?

elements.title: Svante Odén (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Swedish meteorologist Svante Odén was among the first scientists to address and publicize the problems of acid precipitation in Europe?

elements.title: Tomorrow Belongs to Me (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that almost as soon as Cabaret opened, people mistakenly complained the song "Tomorrow Belongs to Me" was a genuine Nazi anthem?
